Engine

Class Collision

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.Collision
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Collision
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This handles all sort of collision in the game, Character->Tile, Character->Character and more It contains methods that is constantly called and methods that is only invoked when with certain events occur (such as attacks).
    Version:
    2013-02-28
    Author:
    Richard Norling
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Collision(PlayerCharacter player, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> blockTiles, java.util.ArrayList<Character> characters)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAttackCollision(Character c)
      Checks if a EnemyCharacter is inside a Player attack area, invoked when Player attacks.
      void checkBorderCollision()
      Checks for NPC to Map-Border collisions
      void checkCharacterCollision()
      Checks for all Character to Character collision ( NOT PLAYER ) Uses a overridden equals() in Character.
      void checkCharacterTileCollision()
      Checks for all character tile collision ( NON PLAYER )
      void checkEnemyAttackCollision()
      Checks if a Player is inside a EnemyCharacter attack area, invoked when EnemyCharacter attacks.
      void checkInteractCollision()
      Checks if a player is inside a interact Area, if true, interact() is called.
      void checkItemCollision()
      Checks if a Player is colliding with a Item
      void checkPlayerCharacterCollision()
      Checks for Player to Character collision
      void checkPlayerTileCollision()
      Checks for Player to BlockTile collision
      void checkSenseCollision()
      Checks if a Player is inside a EnemyCharacter Sense Area, if true, EnemyPlayer detects Player
      void checkSingleCharacterTileCollision(Character character)
      Checks for a single Character to Tile collision shouldn't be updated constantly.
      void moveBack(Character character)
      Moves the character one pixel back from the way he is moving
      void pushCharacter(Character pusher, Character target, int pixels)
      Pushes a character a certain amount of pixels in a certain direction depending on the attackers direction.
      void setCurrentCharacters(java.util.ArrayList<Character> characters)
      Updates active characters
      void setCurrentItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> items)
      Updates active items
      void setCurrentTiles(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> blockTiles)
      Updates active BlockTiles
      void update()
      Checks for new collisions, updates constantly

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
